intro: Restio mastersii, commonly known as the Natal restio, is a member of the Restionaceae family, native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white to pale blue flowers. Restio mastersii typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in coastal and mountainous regions. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing habitat and nectar for various insects and birds.
